text: Yves Coppens (9 August 1934 â€“ 22 June 2022) was a French anthropologist. He studied ancient hominids. In 2014, he became a member of the Pontifical Academy of Sciences. He also helped make documentaries about hominids such as A Species Odyssey. He played an important role in discovering "Lucy". He was elected a member of the Academia Europaea in 1988.
